results.name: Number of intersections of diagonals in the interior of regular n-gon.
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000 [First 1000 terms from T. D. Noe]

M. F. Hasler, Interactive illustration of A006561(n), Sep 01 2017. (For colored versions see A006533.)

R. G. Wilson V, Illustration of a(10)
Index entry for Sequences formed by drawing all diagonals in regular polygon
formula: Let delta(m,n) = 1 if m divides n, otherwise 0.
- 96*n*delta(90,n) - 144*n*delta(120,n) - 96*n*delta(210,n). [Poonen and Rubinstein, Theorem 1] - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 09 2017

For odd n, binomial(n,4) = n(n-1)(n-2)(n-3)/24, see A053126. For even n, use this formula, but then subtract 2 for every 3-crossing, subtract 5 for every 4-crossing, subtract 9 for every 5-crossing, etc. The number to be subtracted is one smaller than a triangular number. - _Graeme McRae_, Dec 26 2004
maple: delta:=(m,n) -> if (n mod m) = 0 then 1 else 0; fi;
program: def d(n,m): return not n % m
xref: Sequences related to chords in a circle: A001006, A054726, A006533, A006561, A006600, A007569, A007678. See also entries for chord diagrams in Index file.
See A290447 for an analogous problem on a line.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Bjorn Poonen (poonen(AT)math.princeton.edu)
